question: A climax fire ecosystem requires periodic forest fires to maintain stability. Which of these would be the most likely result of preventing natural fires from occurring in this ecosystem?
candidate_answers: (A) Pine species would reproduce more rapidly. (B) Broadleaf species would replace pine species. (C) Burning areas would be more easily contained. (D) Trees would spread into previously unforested areas.
answer: Pine species would reproduce more rapidly.
label: A
